item.title: Requesting help!
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

It’s extreamly easy, just make two new varibles (I named it skilltoggle) and add these two commands:

if(cmd.equals("showstats")) { if(player.getSkillToggle() > 0) { player.setSkillToggle(player.getSkillToggle() - 1); player.getActionSender().sendSkillToggle(); player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your stats are now open to the public viewing."); }else{ player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your stats are already showing."); } } if(cmd.equals("hidestats")) { if(player.getSkillToggle() < 1) { player.setSkillToggle(player.getSkillToggle() + 1); player.getActionSender().sendSkillToggle(); player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your stats are now closed to the public viewing."); }else{ player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your stats are already hidden."); } }
Then change your code a little so if skill toggle is 1, the stats wont show.

EDIT: I’m sure there are a lot of different ways of doing this, but this was the easiest for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Requesting help!
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Well I thought id implement the ::stats command that was discussed in the development section, exept add an option for players to hide their stats. Here’s what I’ve gotten so far…

Commands

if(cmd.equals("stats")) { Properties props = new Properties(); Player p = world.getPlayer(DataConversions.usernameToHash(args[0])); isShowing = Integer.parseInt(props.getProperty("isshowingstats"); if(p != null || isShowing = true) { String str = "@gre@Stats for " + p.getUsername() + ": @whi@"; for(int i=0; i < Formulae.statArray.length; i++) str += Formulae.statArray[i] + ": " + p.getMaxStat(i) + ", "; player.getActionSender().sendAlert(str.substring(0, str.length() - 2), false); } else if(publicStats = false) { player.getActionSender.sendMessage("This player has blocked public viewing of their stats."); } else { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Invalid player. Please make sure they are online!"); return; } } if(cmd.equals("hidestats")) { Properties pr = new Properties(); pr.setProperty("isshowingstats", "0"); player.getActionSender().sendMessage("@cya@Server: @whi@Your stats have been hidden to the public."); }

Player Class ( <---- happy Peeter?) i think this is pointless though…

publicStats = Integer.parseInt(props.getProperty("isshowingstats"));

in the players config file, its suppose to show up as

isshowingstats=true

However I’m getting these errors…
